headline: Bodies found in the Seine: Two criminal investigations deepen the mystery
description: Four bodies discovered near Pont de Choisy in a Paris suburb had not all been submerged at the same time. Examinations revealed signs of violence on two of them, prompting two murder investigations.

headline: In 'Together', a codependent couple is put through the wringer of body horror
description: A surprising, playful and audacious debut that explores the dynamics of marriage and the torment of the attraction-repulsion cycle.

headline: Henri Matisse and his heirs: The end of a financial windfall
description: Since Henri Matisse's death in 1954, four generations of his family have guarded his vast body of work jealously and with the utmost discretion. But when the painter's work entered the public domain in January, it ended the lucrative reproduction rights the heirs had enjoyed, as well as their oversight of everything concerning their ancestor.

headline: A winemaker, his daughter and a vintage for their undocumented workers
description: In southeastern France, Philippe Grisard and his daughter, Nad√®ge, rely daily on undocumented workers to help tend their vineyard. To draw attention to their workers' precarious legal status, they named one of their vintages 'Sans eux' ('Without Them').

headline: France faces sharp decline in priestly vocations
description: The number of priests has fallen from 65,000 in 1960 to around 12,000 today. While recruiting foreign priests and merging parishes have eased the decline, the Catholic Church in France continues to grapple with how to address the phenomenon.
